It is a coniferous evergreen tree characterized by its conical shape and dense foliage. The leaves are needle-like, short, and arranged in spirals along the shoots. It produces cones that mature over a two-year cycle, with the female cones typically reddish-brown in color. This plant thrives in cool, moist climates and is often found in high-altitude forests.
